abstracts.cdata!:
The Emergency Municipal Services
            Rehabilitation Project in the West Bank and Gaza, entails
            construction works, and operation of sewage and water
            supply, cleaning of networks regarding water, wastewater,
            and storm drainage, as well as construction of buildings,
            roads, and electricity rehabilitation. This will potentially
            generate water line breaks, dust emissions, noise
            disturbances, in addition to pollution resulting from
            construction debris, and/or toxic gases emanating from
            manholes, and other facilities. This environmental
            assessment stipulates mitigation measures as follows. A
            survey of existing facilities will be conducted during the
            design face to establish appropriate work schedules (limited
            to day times), provide traffic safety regulations, and
            enforce waste disposal regulations, while a re-vegetation
            plan will be implemented following construction. Waste
            disposal will be strictly controlled and monitored for
            disposal at selected (sanitary) landfills; this includes the
            provision of equipment to facilitate flushing, hosing, and
            cleaning, as well as air jitters to vacuum toxic gases from
            manholes. Solid waste burning will be prohibited, instead,
            wastes shall be incased, and transported to dumping sites
            (which should be fenced). Electricity poles to be relocated,
            or installed should be insulated, a practice to be followed
            by routine checks, and monitoring.
